ğŸ“ Solution

This program requests three keys from the user and if they are all valid the flag gets shown. Inside the â€œvalid_key()â€ function the program checks if the string has a length of 11 and if the first character of the string is equal to â€œAâ€ and the fourth and eighth equal to â€œ-â€œ, no other characters are checked so we can randomly pick their values. The same key can also be used, so using â€œAâ€”â€”â€”-â€œ three times will grant us the flag.

Have a great day :) github.com/johnnnathan

ğŸ”‘ Keygen (Python)

import random
import string

def create_random_string():
    s = ['A'] + [random.choice(string.ascii_letters + string.digits) for _ in range(10)]  
    s[3] = '-'  
    s[7] = '-'
    return ''.join(s)

result = create_random_string()
print(result)
